question: What companies are being combined?
answer: Valmet and Neles
context_snippet: The Boards of Directors of Valmet and Neles have agreed upon the combination of the two companies
full_context:
MERGER AND LISTING PROSPECTUS 
SEPTEMBER 2, 2021
 
  
The Boards of Directors of Valmet Oyj (“Valmet”) and Neles Corporation (“Neles”) have, on July 2, 2021, agreed upon the combination of the 
two companies by signing a combination agreement (the “Combination Agreement”) and a merger plan (the “Merger Plan”), according to 
which Neles shall be merged into Valmet through a statutory absorption merger in accordance with the Limited Liability Companies Act 
(624/2006, as amended) (the “Finnish Companies Act”) whereby all assets and liabilities of Neles shall be transferred without a liquidation 
procedure to Valmet (the “Merger”). The Boards of Directors of Valmet and Neles have on August 9, 2021 proposed that the Extraordinary 
General Meetings (“EGM”) of Valmet and Neles convened to be held on September 22, 2021 would resolve upon the Merger as set forth in the 
Merger Plan. The completion of the Merger is subject to, among others, approval by the EGMs of Valmet and Neles, obtaining necessary merger 
co... [truncated]
actual_answer: Valmet and Neles are being combined.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is identical to the expected answer, making it completely correct and comprehensive.

question: Which Finnish law governs the merger?
answer: The Finnish Companies Act (624/2006)
context_snippet: The Merger will be carried out in accordance with the Finnish Companies Act
full_context:
MERGER AND LISTING PROSPECTUS 
SEPTEMBER 2, 2021
 
  
The Boards of Directors of Valmet Oyj (“Valmet”) and Neles Corporation (“Neles”) have, on July 2, 2021, agreed upon the combination of the 
two companies by signing a combination agreement (the “Combination Agreement”) and a merger plan (the “Merger Plan”), according to 
which Neles shall be merged into Valmet through a statutory absorption merger in accordance with the Limited Liability Companies Act 
(624/2006, as amended) (the “Finnish Companies Act”) whereby all assets and liabilities of Neles shall be transferred without a liquidation 
procedure to Valmet (the “Merger”). The Boards of Directors of Valmet and Neles have on August 9, 2021 proposed that the Extraordinary 
General Meetings (“EGM”) of Valmet and Neles convened to be held on September 22, 2021 would resolve upon the Merger as set forth in the 
Merger Plan. The completion of the Merger is subject to, among others, approval by the EGMs of Valmet and Neles, obtaining necessary merger 
co... [truncated]
actual_answer: The Finnish Companies Act governs the merger.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is identical to the expected answer, making it a perfect match.

question: What financial reporting frameworks were used to prepare the financial statements referenced in the Merger Prospectus?
answer: The financial statements referenced in the Merger Prospectus were prepared in accordance with IFRS as adopted by the European Union (EU) for the audited consolidated financial statements as at and for the year ended December 31, 2020, and in accordance with IAS 34 – Interim Financial Reporting for the unaudited consolidated half-year financial report as at and for the six months ended June 30, 2021 and the unaudited comparative financial information for the six months ended June 30, 2020.

1. The question 
2. The correct answer based solely on the provided context 
3. The specific context snippet that contains the answer 

Make sure each question:
- Is answerable from the given context 
- Is a questions that require understanding the content and making simple connections 
- Has a clear, unambiguous answer

question: What key drivers in Valmet's R&D focus?
answer: Customer needs and sustainability are key drivers in Valmet’s R&D work.
context_snippet: Valmet is constantly focusing on new technologies and on R&D to improve product cost competitiveness and performance and to develop new technologies and services. Customer needs and sustainability are key drivers in Valmet’s  R&D work and the company is continuously aiming to improve the raw material, energy and water efficiency of its customers’ production processes.
full_context:
The markets in which the Combined Company operates are also characterized by continuously evolving technologies. 
Valmet is constantly focusing on new technologies and on R&D to improve product cost competitiveness and 
performance and to develop new technologies and services. Customer needs and sustainability are key drivers in Valmet’s 
R&D work and the company is continuously aiming to improve the raw material, energy and water efficiency of its 
customers’ production processes. Valmet’s 16 pilot facilities carry out both internal R&D and customer projects. Neles 
continuously invests in R&D to meet and exceed the tightening sustainability requirements. In addition to performance, 
suitability for new markets and cost competitiveness, a key driver in Neles’ R&D is product safety. Neles has also set 
sustainability targets, such as reducing emissions for all its R&D projects to help its customers to meet environmental 
requirements. The Combined Company is expected to continue this focus on R&D. 
In planni... [truncated]
actual_answer: Valmet's R&D focus is driven by customer needs and sustainability. The company aims to improve the cost competitiveness, performance, and develop new technologies and services for its customers. Additionally, it strives to enhance the raw material, energy, and water efficiency of its customers' production processes.
grading_explanation: The actual answer correctly identifies customer needs and sustainability as key drivers in Valmet's R&D work, and it also provides additional details that further illustrate these points.

question: What could have a material adverse effect on the Combined Company's competitiveness, business, financial position, results of operations, and future prospects?

Failure to protect or enforce intellectual property rights could have a material adverse effect on the Combined 
Company’s competitiveness as well as on its business, financial position, results of operations and prospects. 
Valmet and Neles have taken measures to protect the products and intellectual property rights related to the companies 
through patents, utility models and trademarks, among others, and the Combined Company is expected to continue to 
take such measures in the future. The protection of intellectual property rights is important for the Combined Company.

having been copied, especially in emerging markets. The Combined Company will monitor intellectual property rights 
protected by third parties in order to avoid ... [truncated]
actual_answer: Failure to protect or enforce intellectual property rights.

question: What assurance can be given that the financing terms of the Combined Company will be the same as those of Valmet and Neles prior to the merger?
answer: There is no assurance that the financing terms of the Combined Company will be the same as those of Valmet and Neles prior to the merger.
context_snippet: There can be no assurance that any future financing arrangements of the Combined Company would have similar conditions as the New Facilities Agreements entered into prior to the Merger.

ned Company upon the completion of the Merger. There

the New Facilities Agreements entered into prior to the Merger. The terms of financing available for the Combined 
Company will be affected by the development of the Combined Company’s business. Although Valmet and Neles have 
obtained commitments for financing for the Merger under the New Facilities Agreements, exceptional financial market 
conditions could also lead to increased costs and weaker availability of external financing needed in order to carry out the 
Combined Company’s business. Failures in the efficient management of capital, including breaches of financial covenants 
contained in financing arrangements and agreements or negligence related to the Combined Company’s financing 
arrangements, could result in premature termination of financing agreements or acceleration of credits and other financing 
arrangements. Such failures ... [truncated]
actual_answer: None, as stated in the context, there can be no assurance that future financing arrangements of the Combined Company would have similar conditions as the New Facilities Agreements entered into prior to the Merger.
grading_explanation: The actual answer correctly states that there is no assurance that the financing terms of the Combined Company will be the same as those of Valmet and Neles prior to the merger, aligning perfectly with the expected answer.

question: What is the purpose of the Pro Forma Information included in this Merger Prospectus?
answer: The Pro Forma Information is included for illustrative purposes only and may differ materially from the Combined Company’s actual results and financial position.

Prospectus. See also “Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information” and “Risk Factors – Risks Related to the Merger – 
The Pro Forma Information in this Merger Prospectus is presented for illustrative purposes only and may differ materially 
from the Combined Company’s actual results and financial position”. 
Alternative Performance Measures

question: What conditions need to be met for the Merger Consideration Shares to be listed on Nasdaq Helsinki?

grading_explanation: The actual answer correctly and completely addresses the conditions for the Merger Consideration Shares to be listed on Nasdaq Helsinki, as stated in the expected answer. The actual answer is also relevant and precise.

question: What are Valmet's targets for reducing CO₂ emissions in its own operations, supply chain, and for its customers?
answer: Valmet aims to reduce CO₂ emissions in its own operations by 80% by 2030 (baseline 2019), in its supply chain by 20% by 2030 (baseline 2019), and enable carbon neutral production for all its pulp and paper industry customers by 2030.
context_snippet: The targets defined in Valmet’s climate program are: • reduce CO₂ emissions in Valmet’s supply chain by 20 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019); • reduce CO₂ emissions in Valmet’s own operations by 80 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019); and • enable 100 percent carbon neutral production for all Valmet’s pulp and paper industry customers by 2030 by developing new process technologies and by improving the energy efficiency of Valmet’s current technology offering by 20 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019).
full_context:
CO₂ emission reduction targets and 
concrete actions for the whole value chain, including Valmet’s own operations, the supply chain, and the use of Valmet’s 
technologies by its customers. The program is aligned with the Paris Agreement 1.5°C pathway and the United Nations 
Sustainable Development Goals. Valmet’s climate targets have been assessed and validated by the Science Based Targets 
Initiative. 
The targets defined in Valmet’s climate program are the following: 
• 
reduce CO₂ emissions in Valmet’s supply chain by 20 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019); 
• 
reduce CO₂ emissions in Valmet’s own operations by 80 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019); and 
• 
enable 100 percent carbon neutral production for all Valmet’s pulp and paper industry customers by 2030 
by developing new process technologies and by improving the energy efficiency of Valmet’s current technology 
offering by 20 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019). 
 
In view of Valmet’s management, Valmet’s approach of continuously improving its performance has... [truncated]
actual_answer: Valmet aims to reduce CO₂ emissions in its own operations by 80 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019). In its supply chain, the goal is to reduce emissions by 20 percent by 2030 (baseline 2019). For its customers in the pulp and paper industry, Valmet intends to enable 100 percent carbon neutral production by 2030 through the development of new process technologies and a 20 percent improvement in energy efficiency by 2030 (baseline 2019).
grading_explanation: The actual answer is mostly correct, with minor issues. The actual answer correctly states Valmet's targets for reducing CO₂ emissions in its own operations and in its supply chain. However, it incorrectly states that Valmet intends to enable 100% carbon neutral production for its customers, while the expected answer states 100% carbon neutral production for all its pulp and paper industry customers. Additionally, the actual answer mentions a 20% improvement in energy efficiency for its customers, which is not mentioned in the expected answer. Overall, the actual answer is mostly correct but missing some key details.

question: What role does the audit committee play in assessing the financial statements of Valmet?
answer: The audit committee assesses Valmet’s draft financial statements and interim reports, accounting policies, accounting principles of significant or exceptional business transactions, management forecasts and statements relating to Valmet’s short-term outlook. It also assesses compliance with laws and provisions and with internal instructions, as well as the efficiency of internal control and risk management.
context_snippet: e: • assesses Valmet’s draft financial statements and interim reports, accounting policies, accounting principles of significant or exceptional business transactions, management forecasts and statements relating to Valmet’s short-term outlook; • assesses compliance with laws and provisions and with internal instructions, as well as assesses the efficiency of internal control and risk management.
full_context:
e: 
• 
assesses Valmet’s draft financial statements and interim reports, accounting policies, accounting principles of 
significant or exceptional business transactions, management forecasts and statements relating to Valmet’s short-
term outlook; 
• 
assesses compliance with laws and provisions and with internal instructions, as well as assesses the efficiency 
of internal control and risk management; 
• 
approves the audit plans of internal and independent auditors and follows up reporting related to these plans; 
• 
prepares for the election of independent auditors, monitors the statutory auditing of the financial statements and 
consolidated financial statements, assesses and reviews the auditors’ reports with the auditors, and assesses the 
quality and scope of the audit. Additionally, it assesses the independence of the auditors, particularly any impact 
on independence arising from other services they offer to Valmet; 
• 
pre-approves all non-audit services provided by the independent auditors; 
• 
ass... [truncated]
actual_answer: The audit committee of Valmet is responsible for assessing the draft financial statements and interim reports, accounting policies and principles, management forecasts, and statements related to the company's short-term outlook. They also evaluate compliance with laws, provisions, and internal instructions, and assess the efficiency of internal control and risk management.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is completely correct and comprehensive, covering all the points mentioned in the expected answer.

question: What is Neles' mid-term growth ambition?
answer: Neles' mid-term growth ambition is an annual organic growth of at least 5%.
context_snippet: Annual organic growth ambition of at least 5%
full_context:
Annual organic growth ambition of at least 5% 
• 
EBITA margin of at least 15%, while investing in growth 
• 
Maintaining a strong balance sheet (net debt/EBITDA less than 2.5), while investing in growth 
• 
Dividend payout of approx. 40% of net earnings (excluding PPA amortization related to acquisitions) 
Neles’ strategic targets are mid-term ambitions and should not be viewed as guidance for the near-term performance of 
Neles as the current ongoing COVID-19 pandemic continues to create uncertainty and risks of abrupt changes in all 
markets important to Neles and will adversely impact the Neles’ business in the short-term.  
History  
Neles’ history of innovation starts in 1956. Over the years, Neles has expanded from having a pulp and paper market 
focus to being a leading global player in several process industries, including oil and gas refining, petrochemicals and 
industrial gases. Since the 1990s, Neles has been a frontrunner in valve automation and digital solutions for flow control 
applications... [truncated]
actual_answer: Neles aims for an annual organic growth of at least 5%.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is identical to the expected answer, making it completely correct and comprehensive.

question: Who helps the Board of Directors supervise Neles' accounting and financial reporting processes, and what tasks does this committee manage?
answer: The Audit Committee helps the Board of Directors supervise Neles' accounting and financial reporting processes. The committee manages tasks such as reviewing financial statements, risk management, organizing external and internal audits, and ensuring compliance with the Finnish Corporate Governance Code, applicable laws and regulations.
context_snippet: The Audit Committee assists the Board of Directors in supervising the company’s accounting and financial reporting processes, including the review of financial statements of Neles, risk management as well as in organizing external and internal audit. The Audit Committee manages its tasks in accordance with its charter, the Finnish Corporate Governance Code as well as the applicable laws and regulations.
full_context:
Director (2017–2019) 
 
Committees of the Board of Directors 
Audit Committee 
Neles’ Audit Committee (the “Audit Committee”) assists the Board of Directors in supervising the company’s 
accounting and financial reporting processes, including the review of financial statements of Neles, risk management as 
well as in organizing external and internal audit. The Audit Committee manages its tasks in accordance with its charter, 
the Finnish Corporate Governance Code as well as the applicable laws and regulations.  
The Audit Committee comprises at least three members, one of which shall be the Chair of the committee, appointed 
annually by the Board of Directors among its members. The members of the committee must be independent of the 
company and at least one member must also be independent of significant shareholders of the company. The Audit 
Committee as a whole, taking into account members’ complementary skills and knowledge, shall have sufficient expertise 
and experience on the duties of Audit Committe... [truncated]
actual_answer: The Audit Committee, which is a subcommittee of the Board of Directors, assists the Board in supervising Neles' accounting and financial reporting processes. Its tasks include reviewing financial statements, risk management, and organizing both internal and external audits. The committee operates in accordance with its charter, the Finnish Corporate Governance Code, and applicable laws and regulations.
grading_explanation: The actual answer correctly identifies the Audit Committee as the entity responsible for supervising Neles' accounting and financial reporting processes, and it covers all the tasks mentioned in the expected answer. The answer is also relevant and precise.

question: What is the minimum amount of time in advance that a notice to the General Meeting of shareholders must be published according to Valmet's Articles of Association?
answer: The minimum amount of time in advance that a notice to the General Meeting of shareholders must be published according to Valmet's Articles of Association is nine (9) days prior to the record date of the General Meeting of shareholders.
context_snippet: In order to participate in the General Meeting, a shareholder must register with the company at the latest on the date referred to in the notice [...]. General Meetings shall be convened by publishing the notice convening a General Meeting of shareholders on the company’s website or in one or more widely circulated daily newspapers designated by the Board of Directors or otherwise in a verifiable manner no more than three (3) months and no less than three (3) weeks prior to the General Meeting of shareholders, however, in any case, at least nine (9) days prior to the record date of the General Meeting of shareholders.
full_context:

be included in the notice to the General Meeting. A proposal by the Board of Directors for the auditors of the company is 
published in connection with the notice to the General Meeting.  
Pursuant to Valmet’s Articles of Association, General Meetings shall be convened by publishing the notice convening a 
General Meeting of shareholders on the company’s website or in one or more widely circulated daily newspapers 
designated by the Board of Directors or otherwise in a verifiable manner no more than three (3) months and no less than 
three (3) weeks prior to the General Meeting of shareholders, however, in any case, at least nine (9) days prior to the 
record date of the General Meeting of shareholders referred to in Chapter 4, Section 2, Subsection 2 of the Finnish 
Companies Act. In order to participate in the General Meeting, a shareholder must register with the company at the latest 
on the date referred to in the notice co... [truncated]
actual_answer: The notice to the General Meeting of shareholders must be published at least nine (9) days prior to the record date of the General Meeting.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is identical to the expected answer, indicating complete correctness and comprehensiveness.

question: How is taxation handled differently for residents and non-residents in Finland?
answer: Residents are taxed on their worldwide income, whereas non-residents are taxed only on Finnish source income and any income from a permanent establishment located in Finland.
context_snippet: Residents and non-residents of Finland are treated differently for tax purposes. The worldwide income of persons resident in Finland is subject to taxation in Finland. Non-residents are taxed on Finnish source income only. In addition, any income received by a non-resident from a permanent establishment located in Finland is subject to taxation in Finland. Finnish tax treaties may limit the applicability of domestic tax legislation and also preclude the right to tax non-resident’s Finnish source income.
full_context:
horities in effect and available on 
the date of this Merger Prospectus have been taken into account. 
All of the foregoing is subject to change. The changes could affect the tax consequences described below and may also 
be applicable retroactively. 
General 
Residents and non-residents of Finland are treated differently for tax purposes. The worldwide income of persons resident 
in Finland is subject to taxation in Finland. Non-residents are taxed on Finnish source income only. In addition, any 
income received by a non-resident from a permanent establishment located in Finland is subject to taxation in Finland. 
Finnish tax treaties may limit the applicability of domestic tax legislation and also preclude the right to tax non-resident’s 
Finnish source income. 
Generally, an individual is deemed resident in Finland for tax purposes if such individual stays in Finland for more than 
six consecutive months or if the permanent home and dwelling of such individual is located in Finland. A Finnish citizen 
who ... [truncated]
actual_answer: In Finland, residents are taxed on their worldwide income, while non-residents are taxed only on their Finnish source income and any income from a permanent establishment located in Finland. Finnish tax treaties may affect the taxation of non-residents' Finnish source income.
grading_explanation: The actual answer correctly and comprehensively states the differences in taxation between residents and non-residents in Finland. It also mentions the potential impact of tax treaties on non-residents' Finnish source income, which is an important detail.

question: Which person(s) are authorized to represent the company, and how many of them must act jointly?
answer: The persons authorized by the Board of Directors to represent the company must act in pairs, two of them acting jointly.
context_snippet:
5 § Representation right 
The right to represent the company shall be vested with the chairman of the Board of Directors, a member of the Board of Directors and the President, two of them acting jointly, as well as the persons authorized by the Board of Directors to represent the company, two of them acting jointly, or each such person acting together with the chairman of the Board of Directors, a member of the Board of Directors or the President.
full_context:
the vice chairman. 
The resolution of the Board of Directors shall be the opinion which is supported by more than one-half of the members 
present or, in case of a tie vote, the opinion with which the chairman of the meeting concurs. 
5 § Representation right 
The right to represent the company shall be vested with the chairman of the Board of Directors, a member of the Board 
of Directors and the President, two of them acting jointly, as well as the persons authorized by the Board of Directors to 
represent the company, two of them acting jointly, or each such person acting together with the chairman of the Board of 
Directors, a member of the Board of Directors or the President. 
6 § Accounting period 
The company’s accounting period is a calendar year. The company’s first accounting period ends on December 31, 2013. 
7 § Auditor 
The company has one (1) auditor, which must be an auditing firm certified by the Finland Chamber of Commerce. 
The term of office of the auditors expire at the closing of the Ann... [truncated]
actual_answer: The persons authorized by the Board of Directors to represent the company can do so in pairs, acting jointly.
grading_explanation: The actual answer is identical to the expected answer, both in terms of the persons authorized and the requirement for them to act jointly.
